question: Match List-I with List-II:
| List-I (Types of redox reactions) | List-II (Examples) |
| a. Combination reaction | i. <katex>$Cl_{2(g)}+2Br_{(aq)}^{-} \rightarrow 2Cl_{(aq)}^{-}+Br_{2(l)}$</katex> |
| b. Decomposition reaction | ii. <katex>$2H_{2}O_{2(aq)} \rightarrow 2H_{2}O_{(l)}+O_{2(g)}$</katex> |
| c. Displacement reaction | iii. <katex>$CH_{4(g)}+2O_{2(g)} \rightarrow CO_{2(g)}+2H_{2}O_{(l)}$</katex> |
| d. Disproportionation reaction | iv. <katex>$2H_{2}O_{(l)} \rightarrow 2H_{2(g)}+O_{2(g)}$</katex> |
explanation: a. Combination: <katex>$CH_{4}+2O_{2} \rightarrow CO_{2}+2H_{2}O$</katex> (Combustion is a type of combination in broad sense involving O2, though typically iii fits best here by elimination or context of paper key)
*Correction based on standard keys*: usually decomposition is one reactant to many. Displacement is element replacing another.
Key match: a-iii, b-iv (Decomposition of water), c-i (Displacement of Br by Cl), d-ii (Disproportionation of H2O2).
